VLIB_ReLU_MaxPooling_2x2_skip2_tile

Detailed Description


Functions

void VLIB_ReLU_MaxPooling_2x2_skip2_tile (const sBuffer_t *pInChannel, const sBuffer_t *pOutChannel, uint32_t shiftQ, uint32_t coeffQ)

Function Documentation

void VLIB_ReLU_MaxPooling_2x2_skip2_tile ( const sBuffer_t *  pInChannel,
const sBuffer_t *  pOutChannel,
uint32_t  shiftQ,
uint32_t  coeffQ 
)

Description:
Performs 2x2 ReLU and MaxPooling operations on N 32-bit input channels producing N 32-bit output channels.
After maxpooling operation, each W x H 32-bit inputs of a single input channel are skipped in alternate horizontal and vertical direction, to produce one (W/2) x (H/2) 32-bit outputs. This output is then rounded and shifted down to a 16-bit range. It is then fed to ReLU operation to remove negative values and stored as output.

Parameters:
[in] *pInChannel Pointer to N 32-bit input channels
[out] *pOutChannel Pointer to N 16-bit ouput channels
[in] *shiftQ Shift factor to adjust output range
[in] *coeffQ Shift factor to adjust coefficient range
Assumptions:
  • Input and output buffer address is aligned to 8-bytes
  • Width and height of the buffer must be a multiple of 2
Implementation Notes:
The code is interruptible.
